definition: to give a present/to accord (a favor)/to grant
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)

sentences.english: For technology columnists, it's a gift that keeps on giving.
sentences.chinese: 对技术专栏作家来说，这是个持续不断赠予的礼物。

sentences.english: Smith you don't realize it's a privilege to practice giving presents to others.
sentences.chinese: 史密斯你不明白，行习给别人赠予是一种特别的恩典。

sentences.english: Mr. King liked the lordliness of giving largess.
sentences.chinese: 金先生喜欢慷慨赠予的贵族气派。

sentences.english: God sees to our needs, as Jesus promised. I accepted the property he gave and named it Asha Dan (Gift of Hope).
sentences.chinese: 上帝赠予了我们的需求，因为耶稣承诺过。

sentences.english: Finally, build the big gazebo that when buying a house, gives room of a party.
sentences.chinese: 最后，把买房时赠予的大露台建成一个聚会场所。

sentences.english: They will adjust their bequests in the light of yours.
sentences.chinese: 他们将根据你的赠予调整自己的遗产分配。

sentences.english: These are known as land-grant schools.
sentences.chinese: 他们叫做“政府赠予土地的学校”。

sentences.english: The latter one was composed in 1801, inscribed directly to his cousin Julita .
sentences.chinese: 后者作于1801年，则直接赠予他的表妹朱丽叶塔。

sentences.english: Why did they give the dragon's eggs to you?
sentences.chinese: 他们凭什么把龙蛋赠予你？

sentences.english: The most precious gift we can offer others is our presence.
sentences.chinese: 我们的存在就是赠予他人最珍贵的礼物。

sentences.english: After he had finished speech, the French President was given an inscribed commemorative plaque from Peking University.
sentences.chinese: 演讲结束后，赠予了法国总统北京大学题字留念匾。

definition: variant of 贈予|赠予[zeng4 yu3]
to give as a present/to repel/to bestow an honorary title after death (old)
to send/to give as a present
(honorific) to present/to give as a present
